excerpt: Opened in 1931, this thermal spa complex offers baths & saunas, plus massages, facials & manicures.
detail_description: Located in Pocos de Caldas, Thermas Antônio Carlos is a grand thermal spa complex built in 1931 with a neo-Roman style. It was designed to be the largest and most renowned in the country at that time. The history of this attraction intertwines with the city's, as it sits on a volcanic caldera discovered by miners.
name: Thermas Antônio Carlos
address: R. Junqueiras, s/n - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-043, Brazil

detail_description: Perched atop the Serra de São Domingos, the statue offers a serene symbol of peace and stunning panoramic views of the city. Visitors have described it as a breathtaking experience, with some recommending it for its fascinating views and easy accessibility. While some caution that not all vehicles may be suitable for the journey up to this remarkable site, many find it to be an unforgettable and highly recommended destination.
name: Serra de São Domingos
address: Estr. Alto da Serra - São Domingos, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-000, Brazil

excerpt: Urban, tree-lined park featuring green space, gardens & paths, plus a fountain illuminated at night.
detail_description: José Affonso Junqueira Park, also known as the green heart of the city, is a popular urban park in Pocos de Caldas. It offers a serene atmosphere with its tree-lined paths, gardens, and illuminated fountain at night. The park is a favorite spot for locals to engage in various activities such as sports, meditation, or simply enjoying the lush surroundings.
name: José Affonso Junqueira Park
address: Av. Francisco Salles, s/nº - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-003, Brazil

detail_description: Pedra Balão is a must-see attraction in Serra de Sao Domingos, known for its intriguing rock formation sculpted by wind and rain erosion. This unique natural wonder piques the curiosity of all visitors with its captivating appearance. In addition to offering a replica of Brazil's most famous monument, this area is also home to the fascinating Pedra do Balao, making it a fantastic destination for nature enthusiasts.
name: Pedra Balão
address: Estr. Pedra Balão, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-511, Brazil

detail_description: Espaço Cultural da Urca is located in the former Cassino da Urca, which was a prominent gambling establishment inaugurated in 1942. The building showcases remarkable eclectic Brazilian architecture and has hosted renowned artists of that time. In the 1980s, it transformed into a cultural center, offering theater performances, musical presentations, and art exhibitions. The beautiful architecture features surrounding balconies and spacious interior halls with wooden parquet floors.
name: Espaço Cultural da Urca
address: Praça Getúlio Vargas, s/n - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-007, Brazil

detail_description: Recanto Japonês is a serene and inspiring oasis located just outside the bustling center of Pocos de Caldas. This outdoor tourist attraction features a picturesque artificial lake teeming with colorful koi fish, charming bridges, and lush trees reminiscent of Japan. Originally established in 1920 as a water reservoir, it later transformed into the enchanting Recanto das Borboletas, celebrated for its rich biodiversity that delighted both locals and visitors alike.
name: Recanto Japonês
address: R. Amapá - Jardim dos Estados, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-070, Brazil

excerpt: Amusement park with a Ferris wheel & roller coaster, plus a small zoo & military museum.
detail_description: Parque Walter World is a must-visit destination in Pocos de Caldas, especially for families traveling with children. Spanning over 150,000 square meters, this amusement park boasts an impressive array of 25 attractions that cater to thrill-seekers and younger visitors alike. Highlights include the exhilarating Dragon Mountain roller coaster, the enchanting Castle of Dreams, and a delightful Ferris wheel that offers stunning views of the park.
name: Parque Walter World
address: Av. Ver. Edmundo Cardilo, 3131 - Jardim Del Rey, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37706-106, Brazil

detail_description: Parque Veu das Noivas is a stunning natural attraction located in the city, surrounded by breathtaking landscapes such as waterfalls and the impressive Pico do Bone. It offers visitors the opportunity to immerse themselves in the beauty of nature and enjoy outdoor activities.
name: Parque Veu das Noivas
address: Poços de Caldas - State of Minas Gerais, Brazil

detail_description: Praça Dom Pedro II in Centro is a great spot to explore historical architecture and enjoy the vibrant local culture. Visitors can take in the charming atmosphere, admire the beautiful flowers, and even discover sulphurous water sources nearby. It's an ideal destination for those looking to immerse themselves in the city's rich heritage while enjoying the natural beauty of the area.
name: Praça Dom Pedro II - Centro
address: Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-035, Brazil

name: Parque Municipal Poços De Caldas..
address: Pista de Cooper e Caminhada - Country Club, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-343, Brazil

name: Chacara Santa Barbara
address: Poços de Caldas - State of Minas Gerais, Brazil

excerpt: Giant statue of Jesus Christ on top of an observation tower offering sweeping views.
detail_description: The Cristo Redentor monument is a stunning statue of Jesus Christ perched atop an observation tower, which provides visitors with breathtaking panoramic views. The monument offers sweeping vistas of the city and its surroundings, making it a popular tourist destination. However, due to its exposed location, visitors should be prepared for windy conditions when visiting. In addition to the incredible views, the statue itself is also a marvel of engineering and design that requires careful maintenance to keep it in pristine condition.
name: Parque do Cristo
address: Estr. Pedra Balão - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-511, Brazil

excerpt: Forests & rocks surround 3 fast-flowing waterfalls, which visitors can see from a viewing deck.
detail_description: Brides' Veil Waterfall is a stunning natural attraction surrounded by forests and rocks, offering visitors the chance to admire three fast-flowing waterfalls from a convenient viewing deck. The experience of being in nature here is truly remarkable, providing astonishing views for photography enthusiasts. It's recommended to plan your visit on a dry day and keep in mind that the site closes at 17:00. While there are no food options available on-site, visitors can explore handcrafted items for sale.
name: Brides' Veil Waterfall
address: Av. João Pinheiro - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-387, Brazil

detail_description: The Relógio Floral, located in Pocos de Caldas, is a charming tourist spot in front of the city's cultural center. It features a variety of flowers and small shrubs arranged to resemble a clock face with its numbers. The clock's hands are operated by a mechanism created in the 1970s by Austrian couple John and Elizabeth Canta as a tribute to the city's centenary.
name: Relógio Floral
address: 343, R. Amazonas, 219 - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-008, Brazil

name: Monkey's fountain
address: Praça Dom Pedro II, s/n - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-035, Brazil

excerpt: Tranquil waterfall & rocky pools in a scenic setting with monkeys & other wildlife.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque landscape of Pocos de Caldas, Fonte dos Amores is a must-visit destination for those seeking romance and natural beauty. This enchanting site features a stunning waterfall cascading into rocky pools, surrounded by lush greenery and vibrant wildlife, including playful monkeys. The centerpiece is a captivating marble sculpture by Italian artist Giulio Starace, depicting an embracing couple that embodies the legends of forbidden love associated with this magical place.
name: Fonte dos Amores
address: R. Piauí, 1 - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-024, Brazil

detail_description: Balneário Dr. Mário Mourão is a public spa located in Pocos de Caldas, offering various types of immersion baths in naturally hot sulfur water with medicinal properties. Visitors have praised the cleanliness and the attentive and polite staff who share stories about the place. The sulfur water has a strong smell initially, but it quickly dissipates, leaving behind a relaxing and therapeutic experience. The prices are affordable, and bath towels are available for rent.
name: Balneário Dr Mário Mourão
address: R. Barros Cobra - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-018, Brazil

detail_description: Santuário Mariano de Schoenstatt - Tabor Fonte de Vida Nova is a serene and tranquil Catholic church that radiates tranquility for those seeking solace in prayer. Surrounded by lush greenery, this blessed sanctuary offers a range of amenities including restrooms, water fountains, and a chapel dedicated to prayer. Additionally, visitors can explore a shop offering religious artifacts.
name: Santuário Mariano de Schoenstatt - Tabor Fonte de Vida Nova
address: Estrada Vicinal Padre José Kentenich, Km 4, Poços de Caldas - MG, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled within the serene Parque Jose Affonso Junqueira, Fonte Luminosa stands as a captivating centerpiece that enchants visitors with its beauty. This stunning fountain, dating back to 1930, transforms into a mesmerizing spectacle each night when it comes alive with synchronized water and light displays set to classical music. The park itself is an oasis of tranquility, perfect for leisurely strolls or simply unwinding on a bench while enjoying the meticulously maintained gardens and trimmed hedges.
name: Fonte Luminosa
address: R. Junqueiras, 57-163 - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, Brazil

detail_description: Zoo Bird, located in Pocos de Caldas, Minas Gerais, is a must-visit for nature enthusiasts. With over 200 species of birds spread across a 1.5 km route, visitors can admire exotic and colorful avian creatures in a lush and enchanting natural setting. The zoo houses over 1,000 birds from more than 300 species, including parrots, macaws, toucans, eagles, and owls.
name: Zoo Bird
address: R. Antônio Bortolan, 910 - Bortolan, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37704-397, Brazil

name: Basilica of Our Lady of Health
address: Praça Monsenhor Faria de Castro, 55 - Região Urbana Homogênea IX, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-049, Brazil

detail_description: Um dos principais atrativos turísticos de Poços de Caldas é o Teleférico Poços de Caldas, que conecta o centro da cidade à impressionante estátua do Cristo Redentor, localizada a 1.500 metros de altitude na Serra de São Domingos. Para embarcar nessa aventura, os visitantes devem se dirigir à bilheteria no Parque Afonso Junqueira.
name: Teleférico Poços de Caldas
address: Avenida Francisco Sales Parque, José Affonso Junqueira, s/n - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-013, Brazil

detail_description: The Historical Museum and Geographic Pocos de Caldas is housed in a late 19th-century building originally built as the residence of Martinico Prado Junior. The Vila Junqueira, as it's known, holds significant architectural value with its Italian civil architecture from the 17th century.
name: Historical Museum and Geographic Pocos de Caldas
address: Villa Junqueira Rua Padre Henry Moton, s/n Urca, Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-009, Brazil

detail_description: Located next to the Thermas, the Calendário Floral is a unique display made of various flowers, pebbles, and cement slabs marking the date and season. It is updated daily, creating a stunning visual representation of each day. The surrounding area offers excellent infrastructure and maintenance with quality bathroom services. Additionally, visitors can enjoy a great atmosphere for meals and explore an interesting museum on-site.
name: Calendário Floral
address: R. Rio de Janeiro, 2 - Região Urbana Homogênea IX, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-011, Brazil

detail_description: Xadrez Gigante, a renowned tourist spot, is an impressive chessboard phenomenon that captivates visitors from all walks of life. This colossal chess set enthralls with its grandeur and allure. The gigantic chess pieces are meticulously crafted to perfection, presenting an awe-inspiring spectacle for onlookers. This popular landmark beckons enthusiasts of the noble game, as well as those seeking a unique cultural experience.
name: Xadrez Gigante
address: R. Junqueiras, 2 - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-007, Brazil

detail_description: Represa Bortolan - Ribeirão das Antas is a picturesque reservoir surrounded by lush greenery and rolling hills. Visitors can enjoy various water activities such as swimming, boating, and fishing in the tranquil waters. The area is perfect for nature lovers looking to relax and unwind amidst stunning natural landscapes.
name: Represa Bortolan - Ribeirão das Antas
address: Av. João Pinheiro - Bortolan, Poços de Caldas - MG, Brazil

detail_description: Parque Municipal Antônio Molinari is a perfect spot for spending quality time with family and friends. The park offers various attractions such as a BMX and skate track, sports courts, chess and checkers tables, soccer fields, a playground for kids, outdoor gym equipment, and an artificial lake. Located in the green city of Poços de Caldas, it provides numerous options for outdoor activities. Visitors can enjoy walking, playing games or simply relaxing amidst the peaceful surroundings.
name: Parque Municipal Antônio Molinari
address: R. Sen. Salgado Filho, S/N - Country Club, Poços de Caldas - MG, Brazil

detail_description: The Botanical Garden Foundation of Pocos de Caldas is a well-maintained garden with beautiful greenhouses and a stunning viewpoint. It plays a crucial role in preserving botanical species in the Serra da Mantiqueira and Southern Minas regions, featuring medicinal plants and various specialized greenhouses. The guided tour is highly recommended as it provides in-depth information about the garden's diverse plant collection and takes visitors to exclusive areas.
name: Botanical Garden Foundation of Pocos de Caldas
address: R. Paulo de Oliveira, 320 - Parque Veu das Noivas, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37704-377, Brazil

detail_description: The Paróquia São Domingos, a Catholic church, is an ecclesiastical entity that plays a vital role in the religious community. This religious institution holds great importance as a place of worship and spiritual guidance for its followers. The Paróquia São Domingos serves as a center for Catholicism, offering various sacraments and rituals to its members. It acts as a hub for congregants to come together in prayer and fellowship, fostering a sense of unity and devotion among its attendees.
name: Paróquia São Domingos
address: R. Padre Henry Moton, 10 - São Domingos, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-009, Brazil

detail_description: Ampliart is an auction house that offers excellent service, conveying security, reliability, and speed in dealing with customers. It's a worthwhile place to have art objects due to the professionalism of the staff. The gallery is described as an oasis of creativity and beauty, showcasing masterpieces that provide a window into a world of imagination and artistic expression. The colors on canvases and the essence captured in sculptures are captivating, reflecting the heart and soul put into creating these awe-inspiring works.
name: Ampliart
address: R. Paraná, 487 - Da Saude, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37713-047, Brazil

detail_description: The Galeria e Atelier de Arte Ziriguidum is a captivating space where creativity and artistic expression flourish. This gallery pulsates with an abundance of beauty and ingenuity, offering visitors a unique and immersive experience. The works of art on display are truly disruptive, pushing boundaries and challenging traditional conventions. The talented artist Dalmoni stands out for her ability to convey deep emotions through her creations.
name: Arte Ziriguidum
address: R. Ouro Preto, 102 - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-031, Brazil

detail_description: Mirante Santa Rita is a beautiful viewpoint with a spacious and wooded area that offers various amenities such as a football court, volleyball area, playground for children, exercise equipment, swings, bathrooms, and parking. The community is encouraged to maintain the mirante's cleanliness and vibrancy. It hosts events with live music showcasing youth culture expressions like rap, rock, MPB, and samba. The breathtaking view makes it an ideal spot for family gatherings or romantic outings.
name: Mirante Santa Rita
address: R. Júpiter, 1 - Jardim Santa Rita, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-151, Brazil

detail_description: St. Benedict Church is a stunning example of traditional Brazilian architecture, located in the charming Centro of Pocos de Caldas. Its impressive stone facade and intricate designs reflect the area's rich cultural heritage, making it a must-visit for both locals and tourists. While exploring this beautiful church, visitors can appreciate its historical significance and inviting atmosphere. Although some may find it closed during their visit, the exterior alone is worth stopping by for a moment of reflection or gratitude.
name: St. Benedict Church
address: Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-019, Brazil

detail_description: Mirante do Cristo is a breathtaking viewpoint that offers some of the most stunning panoramas in the city. As you make your way to this incredible spot, be prepared for a scenic journey, although note that the access road lacks a shoulder. Once you arrive, you'll find clean facilities and various attractions like souvenir shops and food options—though prices can be on the higher side. For those looking for an extra thrill, activities such as tree climbing and swings are available for purchase.
name: Mirante do Cristo
address: Estr. do Cristo - Centro, Poços de Caldas - MG, Brazil

name: Sonhos Radicais - Paredão
address: Guapé, MG, 37177-000, Brazil

name: Esportes Radicais Pé no Mato
address: Estrada Alto da Serra - São Domingos, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37719-899, Brazil

name: Parquinho da Vila Nova
address: R. Antônio Pereira Guimarães, 333-429 - Vila Nova, Poços de Caldas - MG, 37701-105, Brazil
